It's all the vision of the I-Cubs' photographer, who grew up attending a baseball camp for the deaf and was inspired to take action when he discovered that camp no longer exists. Cubs Follow MiLB podcast previews Futures Game, MLB Draft We've got Draft fever! On the latest episode of The Show Before the Show podcast, Sam and Tyler preview the All-Star Futures Game and the Draft, Ben shares an inspirational story and much more. MLB outfielder-turned-pitcher spins scoreless frame in High-A debut The Guardians’ High-A affiliate, the Lake County Captains, welcomed a new guy to the bullpen Wednesday night. At 6-foot-1 and 202 pounds, he features a mid-90s heater and a wicked sharp slider. And he happens to be 34 years old. T. A balk caused by a sudden thunder clap? See (and hear!) it for yourself Thunder and lightning are nothing new around the ballpark. In fact, in some parts of the country, summer thunderstorms are quite common. But what happened during a game between the Norfolk Tides (Triple-A affiliate of the Orioles) and the Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp (Marlins) at Vystar Ballpark on Tuesday wasn't common Tides Follow Orioles Follow Here are the Minors' weirdest plays and stats from the last month Five outs recorded over the course of two plate appearances? Walk-off balks? Two-run sacrifice flies? These are the weirdest stats and plays from the last month of Minor League Baseball action. Leave your mark on baseball history -- literally! We’ve built an 8-foot replica game ball (yes, seriously, it’s HUGE!) and are embarking on the ultimate summer road trip to 15 MiLB ballparks and MLB’s NYC headquarters in a mission to set a world record for the most signatures on a baseball. See where the World's Most Autographed Baseball is headed next! Team-by-team breakdown of every player headed to Futures Game It’s almost time for the 26th All-Star Futures Game. As always, it provides a strong look into the future for all 30 organizations, with the game’s top prospects on the field at the same time. MiLB podcast: New Erie identity, new ballparks, new Top 100 On the latest episode of The Show Before the Show podcast, Ben and Sam look at Erie's new alternate identity created by John Oliver, Ben chats with Lauren Matthews from Fifth Third Park and much more! SeaWolves Follow Tigers' McGonigle, Nats' Sykora headline June's Minor League Players of the Month Minor League Baseball announced the Player and Pitcher of the Month Award winners for June in Major League Baseball’s player development system. Orioles affiliate honors the Milkman with must-see bobblehead Typically, the Chesapeake Bay area is associated with scenic shorelines, but it felt more like Home on the Range when the Double-A Baysox unveiled an udderly one-of-a-kind Colton Cowser bobblehead. Orioles Follow Baysox Follow C. Cardinals Follow Cyclones Follow Cubs Follow Jumbo Shrimp Follow Express Follow Loons Follow RubberDucks Follow Mudcats Follow Crawdads Follow Bisons Follow Bats Follow 66ers Follow Sea Dogs Follow Meet the Moon Mammoth, the mascot masterminded by John Oliver’s show In the summer of 1991, a scuba diver named George Moon was combing the depths of Lake Pleasant in Erie County, Pa. When he broke the surface, he was carrying with him an almost three-foot long bone.
